title: alternate_eye_color
body:
When a character is drawn with eyes of a different hue from the canonical color. A type of artistic license and should not be considered an error. 

* Examples: 
** [[Hong Meiling]] is often depicted with green eyes instead of the canonical blue eyes.

If a character's eye color is inconsistent in the official material ([[Izayoi Sakuya]] has been shown with both red and blue eyes, [[Kochiya Sanae]] has been shown with both gold and blue eyes, etc.), only apply this tag for colors that do not appear in any official works. Do [b]not[/b] confuse this tag with [[heterochromia]], and do not apply this tag if the work is [[monochrome]] or colored in a way such that characters only have one color each or share the same eye color, such as post #573149 and post #867976.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: ujikintoki_ginka
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. Formerly a youkai in the form of a silver coin (thus her hair color), she's now taken a human shape to serve as a [[maid]] for her master, [[Kamishiro Seren]], in the Karindou shop. At roughly 180 years old, she's often paired subordinately with her "twin" older sister, [[ujikintoki_kinka|Kinka]].

Unlike her older sister, she is disciplined, responsible, does almost all the domestic chores... and can USUALLY keep her [[yuri]] tendencies under cover. (So that her prey doesn't see it coming when she's about to strike!)

h4. See Also

* [[Ginru]]

title: ujikintoki_kinka
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. Formerly a youkai in the form of a gold coin (thus her hair color), she's now taken a human shape to serve as a [[maid]] for her master, [[Kamishiro Seren]], in the Karindou shop. At roughly 200 years old, she's often paired as a superior with her younger "twin" sister, [[ujikintoki_ginka|Ginka]].

Unlike her sister, she is generally lazy, irresponsible, and overtly sex-crazed.  Although she slacks and teases, however, she does usually go out of her way to care for her "family".

h4. See Also

* [[Kinru]]

title: elza_straherz
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. 

Roughly two millennia in age and master/teacher as well as next-door-neighbor of [[Kamishiro Seren]]. 

Generally seen wearing a [[kimono]] and an [[hair_ornament|ornament]] in her [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with two raccoon tails drooping off it. She also has purple eyes that have rectangular irises, which supposedly signify she has the ability to become a sage, although she refuses to do so, as that would require giving up worldly pleasures, and she likes those very, very much.

Her personality often swaps between that of a wise elder and a lecherous old man, which goes along with the fact she's actually a [[futanari|hermaphrodite]].  (This is, however, by choice - she can alter her body, and made herself a hermaphrodite.)

She lives with [[Mifilinah Jegell]], a.k.a. "Mifi", who serves as her maid and pseudo-lover.  Because Mifi requires her virginity to keep her magical powers, Elza's unwillingness to consummate Mifi's love for her, and Elza's natural perversion are serious problems to Elza's self-control.

[[Aiina Foxrider]] is an older acquaintance of Elza's, and also a lover, who apparently wants to help Mifi and Elza get together, as well as join in on the love triangle, herself.

She also adopts [[Ran Straherz]] as a "younger sister" after Ran needs somewhere to live.  Ran's traumatic past with sexual deviants puts her completely at odds with the rest of her "family" full of pervs.

Elza also made medicine that lets her freely change from child form to adult form.  She seems to prefer the child form.

title: ginru
body: A minor [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. These [[minigirl|little girls]] are actually automated defense systems built by [[Kamishiro Seren]] in the shape of a bunny-style [[ujikintoki_ginka|Ginka]], supposedly made out of magic explosives and equipped with long-range vision and active sonar (along with optional extras). Though their stated purpose is to defend various parts of the Karindou shop, they can be seen causing trouble and antics with their [[Kinru]] sistren.

title: kinru
body: A minor [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. These [[minigirl|little girls]] are actually automated defense systems built by [[Kamishiro Seren]] in the shape of a cat-style [[ujikintoki_kinka|Kinka]], supposedly made out of magic explosives and equipped with infrared vision and a thermograph (along with optional extras). Though their stated purpose is to defend various parts of the Karindou shop, they can be seen causing trouble and antics with their [[Ginru]] sistren.

title: kagurazaki_haruno
body:
A minor [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. Not much is known about her so far, other than that she's a [[miko]] of the Kagurazaki family and current owner of [[kagurazaki_shizuki|Shizuki]].

She also appears to have boy trouble - she's infatuated with a guy who doesn't seem to notice her (because he's apparently surrounded by other women).

title: chronicles_of_the_sword
body:
"This is another tale of souls and swords..."


Chronicles of the Sword is a mini-game or an alternate history mode in [[Soulcalibur III]], a strange mixture of fighting game and turn-based strategy. 
This mode features a real-time strategy play style, in which the player's and the enemy's units are stationed in several bases (called "strongholds") on the map. 
Each chapter has one or more victory conditions, which can be capturing the enemy's main stronghold,defeating a certain enemy general, or eliminating all enemies in a mission.

title: arshtat_falenas
body:
Arshtat Falenas (アルシュタート ファレナス) is a secondary character in [[Gensou Suikoden V]], ruler of the Queendom of Falena, wife of [[Ferid Egan]], sister of [[Sialeeds Falenas]], and mother of the game's playable protagonist, Prince [[Freyjadour Falenas]].

Years of political scheming by the country's two leading noble families wear at her conscience and patience, leaving her prone to psychotic outbursts fueled by the will and power of the sentient Sun Rune on her forehead. Some time prior to the beginning of Suikoden V, she loses control and turns the Sun Rune on the "rebelling" town of Lordlake, its extreme light and heat evaporating the town's namesake large lake and transforming the immediate vicinity into a dust bowl.

[spoiler]She is murdered relatively early in the game during a coup d'état by the Godwin family. Suffering a full psychotic break in which she murders her husband Ferid, she threatens to use the Sun Rune against the entire country. [[Georg Prime]], following a request from Arshtat and the now-deceased Ferid, murders Arshtat before she can use the Sun Rune again.[/spoiler]

title: f(x)
body:
f(x) (Korean: 에프엑스; pronounced /ˌɛf ˈɛks/) is a five member South Korean girl group formed by SM Entertainment in 2009. The name is a play on the mathematical notation for function, and when input with different 'x', there can be many different outcomes. f(x) strives to be the kind of girl group that can change and adapt to many situations. The group members have also been nicknamed "function girls". The quintet consists of Victoria, Amber, Luna, Sulli and Krystal.

title: bashauma_senki
body:
馬車馬戦記 ([i]Bashauma Senki[/i], lit. Work-Horse War Records) 

[[Hayami Rasenjin]]'s short [[military]] comic stories in his illustration book, 速水螺旋人の馬車馬大作戦 ([i]Hayami Rasenjin no Bashauma Daisakusen[/i]). 

One of the manga, "Pulse-Jet Flamingo", has a sequel novel, 小説 馬車馬戦記 ディエンビエンフー大作戦 ([i]Shousetsu Bashauma Senki[/i]: Dien Bien Phu [i]Daisakusen[/i]). 

h4.Characters in the novel 

* Marsha aka. [[Maria Arkadievna Kharchenko]] (Soviet pilot) 
* [[Irina Khodynskaya]] (Political officer) 
* [[Phan Minh Viet]] (Colonel of the Viet Minh Air Defence Forces) 
* [[Hong Tan Ha]] (Viet's Adjutant) 
* [[tran_(bashauma_senki)|Tran]] (Japanese holdout) 

h4.See also

title: tabard
body:
An official garment of a herald, emblazoned with a coat of arms or a symbol denoting membership. It is a sleeveless or short-sleeved coat/cloth worn over clothing or armor, either down the front or on the front and back. It is a purely cosmetic item intended to add individuality to someone's look, whereas a [[surcoat]] is designed to provide protection from the elements.

Mainly associated with [[Yakumo Ran]], [[Yakumo Yukari]]'s Imperishable Night outfit, and [[Ibaraki Kasen]].

h4.See also

* [[surcoat]]
* [[naked tabard]]

title: closed_umbrella
body: An umbrella or parasol that is not opened up.

title: surcoat
body:
A coat worn over garments. In the 12th century, knights formerly wore surcoats over their armor until suits of plate armor were developed in the 15th century. The surcoat also protected them from poor weather, as well as reflecting heat from the sun. Like the [[tabard]], the surcoat can also bear the wearer's coat of arms.

The best examples in modern media are seen in the [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series.

h4.See also

* [[tabard]]

title: anja_(madoka_magica)
body:
[[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character.

[[albertine (madoka magica)|Albertine]]'s familiars, who appear in episode 5. The Anja seen in the show is a lost familiar who was separated from the witch while playing alone, absorbed in her daydreams. Anja's duty is to be naïve. She possesses the ability to transform humans into [[ball]]s; a human who has been transformed into a ball cannot revert to human form until he bounces against the ground once for each lie that he has ever uttered. 

Anja travels around in a vehicle that can assume several different forms, including an [[airplane]], a [[boat]], and a [[car]].

title: mako_eyes
body:
From Wiki:
Mako is thought to be similar to radioactive materials in that prolonged exposure can lead to genetic mutation, cognitive disability and even death. Individuals who have had prolonged exposure to Mako are identified by a glow in their eyes, referred to as "Mako eyes". All members of SOLDIER bear this distinguishing feature, and, as such, it is considered to be a "mark of SOLDIER."

title: book_focus
body:
One or more [[book|books]] are the focus (the subject, the theme) of the image. Use this tag when books are very conspicuous, very noticeable, very visible.

h4. Examples

As guidelines, use this tag when [b]a great portion of the image[/b] is occupied by:

* A whole book.
** post #811575
* A page of a book.
** post #986356
* Many books.
** post #386794
* Someone reading — or writing, or showing, or reacting to, or hiding behind, or otherwise paying attention to — a [b]very[/b] visible book, that is preferably close to the center of the image.
** post #1039647
** post #948557

h4. Counter-examples

[i]Don't[/i] use this tag with these posts, that break the guidelines:

* post #1051582 (The books are effectively hidden. They don't draw attention.)
* post #1048703 (Same as above.)
* post #455122 (Things, people, situations unrelated to the books are the focus of the image instead.)
* post #989025 (There are only a few books in the background.)

title: rah-66_comanche
body:
Advanced two-seat scout [[helicopter]] being developed by Boeing/Sikorsky until the program was canceled in 2004. The five-bladed RAH-66 had the characteristic boxy, faceted look of an aircraft designed with an emphasis on stealth. This also helped dictate the choice of a "Fenestron":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fenestron tail rotor and retractable gun [[turret]] and internal weapon mounts. The Comanche was to have been able to carry all current helicopter weapons in US inventory, as well as drones.

h4. See also

* Wikipedia: "RAH-66 Comanche":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing-Sikorsky_RAH-66_Comanche
* Youtube: "Discovery Wings: Boeing/Sikorsky RAH-66 Comanche":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g0R1ISQAmqk&feature=related

title: nishi_no_yoki_majo
body:
西の善き魔女, lit. [i]The Good Witch of the West[/i] is a series of fantasy light novels by Noriko Ogiwara. The series has been adapted into both a manga series and a thirteen episode television anime series broadcast in Japan in 2006.

[[Firiel Dee]] is given her mother's necklace by her childhood friend, Rumpelstiltskin(Rune). The necklace was meant as a birthday gift from her remote father, the astrologer Gideon Dee. All fifteen year olds are welcome to attend a public ball at the royal Roland castle in honor of the Queen's Birthday, and Firiel decides to wear her new necklace to the celebration. When it is recognized as a missing talisman of the royal family, this leads to the revelation that Firiel is the daughter of royalty and automatically in competition to become the next Queen.

h4. Character

* [[Firiel Dee]]
* [[Adel Roland]]

h4. See Also

* "Official Site":http://www.imagicatv.jp/content/project-westwitch/index.html
* "[i]Nishi no Yoki Majo[/i] on Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Good_Witch_of_the_West

title: kuudere
body:
A person who hides a warm and gentle side beneath an cold, aloof, blunt, or cynical exterior.  Alternately a person who genuinely is cold except towards one or a few people.

Differs from a [[tsundere]] in that the tsundere tends to prefer a more hot-tempered and hostile mask. 

Differs more subtly from the [[dandere]] in that the latter has is more emotionless than expressively cold, though there's often a lot of overlap in their aloof and anti-social natures.

Comes from "cool" + "dere."

Use this tag only when a character displays warmth and coolness in the same image.

title: triptych_(art)
body:
A triptych is a work of art (usually a panel painting) which is divided into three sections, or three carved panels which are hinged together and can be folded shut or displayed open. 

The middle panel is typically the largest and it is flanked by two smaller related works, although there are triptychs of equal-sized panels.

h4.  See Also:

* [[Folding screen]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]
* [[Triptych]], the [[gothic lolita]] [[eroge]] by ALcot.

h4. External Links:

* "The Wikipedia on Triptychs":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triptych

title: utau_shoujo_no_full_score
body: In a world where both science and magic exist, songs by girls called ‘utahime’ (songstresses) are needed for magic. However, they need to be kissed by their partner in order to boost their powers. Takeru is one of these guys called ‘soushi’ (instrumentalists) and he is partnered with Kaho at the Cantatrice Music Academy. Then one day, his imouto Asuka who is the top utahime in Japan suddenly shows up and tells him to take responsibility for a kiss!

title: yueya_chan
body:
Hanji: 月牙鏟 (Traditional Chinese / Japanese) / 月牙铲 (Simplified Chinese) 
Pronunciation: [i]yuèyá chǎn[/i] (Chinese) / [i]getsuga-san[/i] (Japanese) 

A Chinese [[polearm]] whose name literally means "Crescent Moon Spade". Also known as a Shaolin spade or monk's spade, it is most famously the weapon of [[Sha Wujing]] from the classic novel [[Journey to the West]] 

h4.External Link 

* Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monk%27s_spade

title: hana_to_harinezumi
body:
花とハリネズミ, lit. [i]Flowers and Hedgehog[/i] is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[yamada_(onigori105)|Yamada]] that was published in GANGAN Online starting from March 2012.

Tsukasa Shoutarou is popular but cold with unapproachable atmosphere student council president. Asada Hana is an ordinary high school girl who struggle to get close to him. A story about warm, a bit painful, yet dazzling high school life.

h4. Characters

title: dal
body:
A line of [[Pullip]] [[doll|dolls]].
"Dal is a smaller doll of the Pullip line, introduced in 2006. She is profiled as Taeyang's 13-year-old little sister who considers Pullip as her rival in fashion and style. As Pullip is approximately the same size as Fashion Dolls such as Barbie and Jenny, Dal is similar in size to 'little sister' type dolls, such as Skipper and Licca. Dal is 26.3 cm in height, and comes up to about Pullip's shoulder. 

The Dal body is articulated similar to Pullip. Her eyes move from side to side like Pullip, but do not blink. Dals can be customized. Jun Planning announced in the beginning of 2008 that a new Dal will be released every month. Dals cannot close their eyes." [1] 

h4. See also 

* [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pullip#Dal

title: toshocard
body:
図書カード (Tosho-card or Toshocard) 

Japanese pre-paid cards issued by "Nippon Tosho Fukyû Co.,LTD.":http://www.toshocard.com/ for purchasing books. "[i]Tosho[/i]" means "book(s)" in Japanese. 
In October 2005, "[i]tosho-ken[/i]," Japanese book coupons were completely replaced to "toshocard." 

"Imagine-Hakuyō Group":http://www.imagine-group.jp/ frequently makes pre-order special toshocards because the company was originally a book store chain. 

h4.See also 

* Official page: http://www.toshocard.com/ 
* "Wikipedia article(JP): Toshoken and toshocard":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9B%B3%E6%9B%B8%E5%88%B8#.E5.9B.B3.E6.9B.B8.E3.82.AB.E3.83.BC.E3.83.89

title: belphegor_(demon)
body:
In demonology, Belphegor (or Beelphegor) is a demon who helps people to make discoveries. He seduces people by suggesting to them ingenious inventions that will make them rich.

Some depictions of him indicate he must be worshiped on a toilet, such as the 1863 edition of the [i]Dictionnaire Infernal[/i] which has an illustration of him on a toilet (see wikipedia page). This depiction seems to have caught on in Japan, and this depiction of him is common in the [[Shin Megami Tensei]] series and makes a short cameo toward the end of episode 7 of [[Danshi Koukousei no Nichijou]].

h4. See also

* Wikipedia entry: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belphegor

title: vostok
body:
[b]Vostok[/b] (Russian [i]Восток[/i], translated as "East") was a family of rockets derived from the Soviet R-7 Semyorka ICBM designed for the human spaceflight programme. 

This family of rockets launched the first artificial satellite ("[[sputnik]]") and the first manned spacecraft in human history. It was a subset of the R-7 family of rockets.

h4.See also

* [[Yuri Gagarin]]
* [[Mercury (Spacecraft)]]
* [[Mercury-Redstone]]

title: mercury-redstone
body:
The [b]Mercury-Redstone Launch Vehicle[/b], designed for NASA's Project Mercury, was the first American manned space booster. It was used for six sub-orbital [[Mercury (spacecraft)]] flights from 1960–61; culminating with the launch of the first, and 11 weeks later, the second American (and the second and third humans) in space.

A member of the Redstone rocket family, it was derived from the U.S. Army's Redstone ballistic missile and the first stage of the related Jupiter-C launch vehicle; but to make it man-rated, its structure and systems were modified to improve safety and reliability.

The four subsequent Mercury manned flights used the more powerful Atlas booster to enter low Earth orbit.

title: electric_chair
body:
A specially built chair used in [[electrocution]] [[execution]]s.

The chair itself is primarily a restraining device, using several leather belt straps (or similar mechanisms) to keep the subject firmly restrained in the chair. The actual electrocution is done by a helmet-like headpiece, which is worn on the subject's head and connected by a cable to the electricity generator, and one or two other electrodes attached to the subject's legs, which may be built into the chair itself.

title: asthma
body:
A medical condition where the windpipe is prone to swelling when irritated, blocking the windpipe and causing asphyxiation.

Tag images depicting characters that suffer from asthma and characters suffering from symptoms (asthma attacks, short breath, coughing, wheezing, etc)

Sufferers often carry around inhalers so they can deal with an asthma attack at any time. [[Patchouli Knowledge]] is known for her asthma and poor health.

h4. See also

* [[Asphyxiation]]
* [[Coughing]]
* [[Inhaler]]

title: true_rune
body:
In the [i][[Gensou Suikoden]][/i] series, they are 27 runes that were created as a result of the legendary battle between the Sword and the Shield, which also created the world. They wield immeasurable power and are sentient, choosing their masters at will. When attached to a host, they will appear in the form of a tattoo-like symbol, typically on the host's hand or forehead.

All of the lesser runes that grant magical powers or other special abilities in the games are "descendants" of the True Runes. Some of the more powerful ones are also sentient, but to a lesser degree than the True Runes themselves.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: phantasy_star_zero
body:
[i]ファンタジースターZERO[/i] (Phantasy Star Ø)

A multiplayer action role-playing game released for the [[Nintendo DS]] of the [i][[Phantasy Star]][/i] series by [[Sega]]. The game follows the style of gameplay of the original [i][[Phantasy Star Online]][/i] more than the more recent [i][[Phantasy Star Universe]][/i], though it incorporates mechanics from both. 

While the story and setting are similar to the other [i][[Phantasy Star Online]][/i] games, it takes place in its own universe.

title: phantasy_star_portable
body:
[i]ファンタシースターポータブル[/i] (Phantasy Star Portable)

A multiplayer action role-playing game of the [[Phantasy Star]] series made by [[Sega]]. Released on July 31st 2008 in Japan, March 3rd, 2009 in North America, and April 3rd, 2009 in Europe for the [[Playstation Portable]]. 

[i]Phantasy Star Portable[/i] is a direct sequel to the [i][[Phantasy Star Universe]][/i] series. Its story takes place three months after the events of [i][[phantasy_star_universe|Ambition of the Illuminus]][/i].

title: gottouza
body:
ゴ[b]ッ[/b]トゥーザ様 (Got[b]t[/b]ouza-sama) 

A character from [[Lucky Star]]. Animated representation of [[Gotou Yuuko]], who is in real life (and in quite the contrast to the cute and innocent types she often voice-acts) both an avid biker and proponent of the biker lifestyle. 

The name came from ゴトゥーザ様 (Gotouza-sama), [[Gotou Yuuko]]'s real nickname given by [[Sugita Tomokazu]]. In other words, Gottouza is voiced by Gotouza-sama. 

Gottouza will destroy you, so don't cross her. 

h4.External links 

* Nicopedia article: "Gottouza-sama":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/153878

title: cleaning_ears
body:
Pictures where one character is cleaning another's ear, usually with an ear pick. The latter character's head is almost always in the cleaning character's lap. This usually displays a great amount of comfort or trust between the two characters.

Also known as "mimikaki".
